definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: The systematic application of a screening test in an asymptomatic population.
sentences.chinese: 在無症狀的人羣中有條理地應用篩查檢測。

sentences.english: There were bullet points galore. Complete with photos of fluffy white rabbits and rainbows.
sentences.chinese: 幻燈片條理清晰，並配以大白兔以及彩虹的圖片。

sentences.english: And the way of resolving internal conflicts is by organizing the external environment.
sentences.chinese: 他們需要通過使外部環境條理化來解決內在衝突。

sentences.english: Your clear reasoning is quite correct.
sentences.chinese: 你的條理清楚的推論非常正確。

sentences.english: It allows you to feel confident in your job because you are put-together in your life.
sentences.chinese: 它讓你在工作中感到自信，因爲你生活有條理。

sentences.english: The working environment should be of a structured nature.
sentences.chinese: 工作的環境應該像條理分明的生物界。

sentences.english: The current body of knowledge in this area is scattered and unorganized .
sentences.chinese: 目前在這個領域大量的知識都是離散的和無條理的。

sentences.english: I tried to Bring some order to the Bookshelf.
sentences.chinese: 我設法把書架整得有條理些。

sentences.english: When you sit down to write, the thoughts become more organized.
sentences.chinese: 當你坐下來寫的時候，那些想法變的更有條理了。

sentences.english: She only became coherent again two hours after the attack.
sentences.chinese: 這次攻擊兩小時之後，她纔再一次變的講話有條理。

sentences.english: What is justice? of completely non-structured chaos, their book also.
sentences.chinese: 何謂義？條理之截然不可亂者，其著也。

sentences.english: There were bullet points galore.Complete with photos of fluffy white rabbits and rainbows.
sentences.chinese: 幻燈片條理清晰，並配以大白兔以及彩虹的圖片。

sentences.english: Caffeine increases persuasion through instigating systematic processing of the message.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡因通過促使信息處理條理化而增加說服力。

sentences.english: If the things get organized, perhaps through an outline.
sentences.chinese: 如果條理化，也許會產生一份提綱。

sentences.english: Most of us have a bias toward order and organization.
sentences.chinese: 我們大多數人傾向於秩序和條理性。

definition: handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
disordered and in a mess (idiom); all mixed up and chaotic
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
